intro: Codonoboea hispida, commonly known as the hairy codonopsis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds, and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
